frameDefinitions: This frame has to do with nouns denoting types of entities.

Some Possessor, either a nation, institution, or private individual, controls a Force whose primary functions to defend the Possessor (or, in the case of an institution or individual, some area of land significant to them) and to carry out offensive actions for the Possessor.
A Cognizer construes an Item as belonging to a certain Category.
A recordable sequence of events is associated with a given Topic.
In this frame, the temperature of an Item changes.

This is an abstract frame for durative activities, in which the Agent enters an ongoing state of the Activity, remains in this state for some Duration of Time, and leaves this state either by finishing or by stopping.
frameExamples: I don't like this newfangled <t><fex name='Subtype'>kind</fex></t> of  fish.
You 've already <t>stereotyped</t> me as a bimbo, have n't you?
And that is where the <t>history</t> of art begins.
The house had <t>cooled</t> <t>off</t> by a few more degrees by midnight, and we finally managed to eat a bite.
listRoleDefinitions: The entity which denotes a subtype of the more general <fen>Category</fen>.
The more general type that the target denotes a subtype of. This role is obligatory and should be labeled DNI when not present.
The <fen>Force</fen> is the body of soldiers that acts in military capacity for the <fen>Possessor</fen>. This role is incorporated in each word in this frame.
The <fen>Possessor</fen> is the nation, institution, or individual who possesses and/or controls the <fen>Force</fen>.
This is the person who performs an act of categorization. Typically, this frame element is expressed as an External Argument.
This is the entity which is construed or treated by the <fen>Cognizer</fen> as being an instance of a particular <fen>Category</fen>. Typically, the <fen>Item</fen> is expressed as an Object.

This frame element expresses a general type or class of which the <fen>Item</fen> is considered an instance. Typically, it is expressed in a prepositional phrase headed by <ment>as</ment> or <ment>under</ment>.

This frame element expresses properties of the <fen>Item</fen> which is used as a basis for categorization. <fen>Criteria</fen> are the general dimensions along which <fen>Item</fen>s can potentially differ from one another and hence, fall into different <fen>Category</fen>s. For example, a paint sample can be classified <ment>by color</ment> or <ment>by finish (matte or gloss)</ment>; if they are classified by color, one can be classified <ment>as orange</ment> and another <ment>as red</ment>. The <fen>Criteria</fen> role is typically expressed as a PP headed by <ment>by</ment>, or as a complex PP of the form <ment>on the basis of...</ment>:
This Frame Element marks expressions that indicate when a certain Categorization was made.
The <fen>Topic</fen> is the subject about which the history is given.
When the events concerning the <fen>Topic</fen> occured.
The scalar property that the <fen>Item</fen> possesses.  This role is rarely expressed.
The time at which the change in temperature occurs.
The location at which the <fen>Item</fen> changes temperature.
This role identifies the <fen>Activity</fen> in which the  <fen>Agent</fen>  is engaged.
This role identifies the <fen>Time</fen> when the <fen>Activity</fen> occurs.
This role identifies the <fen>Place</fen> where the <fen>Activity</fen> occurs.
listRoleExamples: I don't like this <fex>kind</fex> of fish.
They created a new breed <fex>of dog</fex>.
The American invasion, which drew 26000 American troops against <fex>General Noriega's</fex> army, was the largest US military operation since Vietnam.
<fex>Kim</fex> categorized the books under fiction. <fex>Kim</fex> categorized them on the basis of genre.
The students were categorized <fex>on the basis of their test scores</fex>.
<fex>20 years ago</fex> people would consider this as nothing unusual
The role of the Byzantine Empire in <fex>European</fex> history is not understood by all.
The raw fish that is to be eaten as sushi has to be meticulously prepared and must first be chilled <fex>in temperature</fex> to exactly above freezing point.

passageCandidateSpans.text: the Quebec Major Junior Hockey League
